title: WWE versus WCW: inside the crazy TV ratings battle that made Dwayne Johnson a star
text:
Twenty years ago, two rival 'fake' wrestling leagues went to war using ludicrous celebrity cameos, outlandish storylines, and some very real animosity. Show business would never be the same again, reports Tom Fordy

On January 4, 1999, The Rock – not yet the world’s biggest box office star – was competing on Monday Night Raw, the flagship TV show from pro wrestling powerhouse WWE (World Wrestling Entertainment). On that night, the villainous Rock was scripted to lose the world title to Mankind, the deranged-but-lovable alter-ego of Mick Foley.

In fact, it had already happened: the match had been recorded a week earlier. WWE – or the WWF as it was then known – was more than three years into the...
description: Twenty years ago, two rival 'fake' wrestling leagues went to war using ludicrous celebrity cameos, outlandish storylines, and some very real animosity.
